title: The Invention of the First Computer
description: ENIAC, considered the first general-purpose electronic computer, was unveiled at the University of Pennsylvania. It could perform complex calculations faster than any previous machine.
caption: ENIAC - The first electronic general-purpose computer.

title: The First Microprocessor
description: Intel releases the first microprocessor, the Intel 4004, revolutionizing computing.
caption: Intel 4004 - the first commercially available microprocessor.

title: The IBM Personal Computer
description: IBM introduces its first Personal Computer (IBM PC), setting standards for PC hardware and operating systems for decades.
caption: IBM PC 5150 - the computer that popularized the PC industry.

title: The Birth of the World Wide Web
description: Tim Berners-Lee publicly releases the World Wide Web, changing how information is accessed and shared globally.
caption: The first web browser - WorldWideWeb, created by Tim Berners-Lee.

title: The Founding of Google
description: Larry Page and Sergey Brin found Google, transforming the way people search for and access information on the internet.
caption: Google's original 1998 logo.

title: The Smartphone Revolution
description: Apple unveils the first iPhone, combining a phone, iPod, and internet communicator, transforming mobile technology forever.
caption: The original iPhone - the start of the smartphone era.

title: The Rise of Cloud Computing
description: Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud gain mainstream adoption, changing how businesses store, process, and scale data.
caption: Cloud computing revolutionizing scalability and remote data access.

title: Advances in Artificial Intelligence
description: AI models like GPT-3 showcase unprecedented natural language processing capabilities, pushing the boundaries of machine learning.
caption: AI reshaping industries and human-computer interaction.
